name: Super-Soft, 100% Natural Facial Cotton
about: What it is:A supply of 100 percent natural, super-soft cotton pads for gentle exfoliation, makeup removal, cleansing, and toning..Skin Type:Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily.Skincare Concerns:Pores, Uneven Texture, and Oiliness.Highlighted Ingredients:- 100 Percent Cotton: Handpicked and woven with a special manufacturing method using only water..Ingredient Callouts:Free of parabens, formaldehydes, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, triclosan, and contains less than one percent synthetic fragrance..What Else You Need to Know:Each square contains a blend of 123,000 cotton fibers, woven into 28 layers with high moisture-absorbing and releasing properties for less wasted product. The facial cotton squares add a gentle exfoliation benefit to improve skin roughness and are specially crafted to maintain their shape so that fibers don't fluff or stick to the face.
ingredients: -Cotton 100%: Is handpicked and then woven with a special manufacturing method using only water.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.To apply softener:.-Pour softener onto the cotton pad after cleansing..-Wrap the cotton around the inner middle finger, between the index and ring fingers..-Starting from the center of the face, use outward strokes to smooth softener across the forehead, from nose to cheeks, around your lips, upward from your chest to neck, and under your chin. . .To remove eye makeup:.-Pour makeup remover onto three cotton padsu2014one for each eye and a third for your eyelashes. .-Rest a cotton pad over each lid and hold it in place for a few seconds. .-Then gently wipe downward and off skin.   .-Place the remaining cotton pad onto the lashes of each eye. .-Hold it in place for a few seconds to break down the mascara..-Wipe from the base to the tip of your eyelashes, starting from outer to inner corner and back again. .-Repeat on your other eye. .-Follow with cleanser.

reviews.review_text: I actually think the price on these is not that bad. Sure; if you are looking at it percentage-wise, each sheet of this cotton (in the 165 sheet pack) is 62.5% more than each cotton round in the cheap pack I was buying from the drugstore. And I wasn't even buying the cheapest option from the drugstore.  But if you just look at the amount, $13 is not a lot for at least 165 uses, front and back. Also, the cheap cotton rounds I get sometimes tear in half as I am either taking them out of the packaging or trying to saturate one with product. These are super thick and soft, and luxurious feeling. The $13 lasts me a pretty long time too, because I don't really use a ton of these.  So in my opinion, the value of these over the drugstore cotton rounds is worth it. They even look nicer in my little cotton storage box than the rounds XD. They're more durable, feel better on the face, and are super thick. In fact, when I look up the sephora organic cotton pads right now, they are $4.50 per 50 pads (9 cents each). These are $13 for 165 sheets (about 8 cents per).   At any rate, these fit into my budget for the value and I really enjoy them and will buy again when I'm out :).

Now I use only these to remove mascara, eyeshadow and eye SPF, and have absolutely zero redness or irritation which I used to experience quite often with normal cotton pads. I don't use these for the rest of my face as they soak up a lot of the micellar water I use and I can find myself going through a bottle much faster. For other areas I just stick to regular drugstore cotton rounds. The other use I have for these is when I have a troublesome patch - rough/dehydrated area or acne mark. I simply cut the pad down to size required to cover the area, soak it with the right watery serum for the purpose and place it over the area. reviews.review_text: The short answer is, it depends. The long answer is.. These are a must-have for sensitive skin. I personally use them to remove makeup, and in combination with my favorite makeup remover (clinique take the day off makeup remover, the one in the bottle) they are beyond amazing. With other cotton pads/rounds, I use eight maybe 7, and the cotton pads cause enough irritation that the concept of a night time skincare routine is ruined because just getting to a second cleanse burns, even with the same makeup remover.  But with these? I use three for a full face of makeup, and two for my half-face or my, I only have time to put on concealer, mascara, brows, blush and the nearest lipstick in sight I just shake my makeup remover, tip five dots on a single pad and press it to my eye for three minutes, wipe down and up, cover every corner of the pad, flip, repeat, throw it away, eye two, repeat, and face.  If you don't have sensitive skin, they still can be a good buy, especially if you are eco-conscious, and even if you're not they are still really soft and feel luxurious on the face, but if you can get away with using four old fashioned cotton rounds, then don't buy them, they're really not that special and not worth the price. I only buy them because my face skin is a drama queen, so yessss, I have to love them lol

reviews.review_text: I usually use the Chanel Le Coton pads. They are wonderful and the gold standard for cotton pads. But they only come in a box of 100, for $20, and I can't find them so easily anymore. So I tried these. They are not as big as my Chanel pads, but are just as thick and soft. And at $12 a box for 165 pads, the price can't be beat. It's possible these pads are even made in the same place, as the Chanel ones come from Japan too. Trust me, try nice cotton pads and you will never be able to go back to the drugstore kind again. They don't soak up all the liquid you really want on your face, and are just so super soft on your skin. And I never get little cotton pieces in my eyelashes and eyes like the cheap pads. It's a small price to pay for some happiness in my daily routine.
